description:
This issue was found in stable/havana when we upgraded nova DB from folsom to havana.

When there are multiple host aggregates associated with an availability zone, the migration logic add all hosts belong to the availability zone to the first host aggregate.

The code at line 41 of /nova/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/147_no_service_zones.py
title: hosts added to the wrong host aggregate in DB sync

comments.content:
This issue was found in stable/havana when we upgraded nova DB from folsom to havana.

When there are multiple host aggregates associated with an availability zone, the migration logic add all hosts belong to the availability zone to the first host aggregate.

The code at line 41 of /nova/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/147_no_service_zones.py
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~weitian

comments.content: Havana is about to go out of support, so I think there is no purpose in fixing this at this point.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
